workflow.name: Automated weekly security audit reports with Gmail delivery
workflow.description:
# ğŸ”’ N8N Security Audit Report - Automated Weekly Email

## ğŸ¯ What does this workflow do?

This workflow automatically generates and emails a comprehensive security audit report for your N8N instance every week. It identifies potential security risks related to:

- **Credentials** ğŸ”‘ : Exposed or insecure credentials
- **Nodes** ğŸ§© : Sensitive nodes (Code, HTTP Request, SSH, FTP, etc.)
- **Instance settings** ğŸ¢ : Global security configuration
- **Community nodes** ğŸ“¦ : Third-party nodes that may pose risks

The report includes direct links to affected workflows, execution statuses, and actionable recommendations.

---

## âœ¨ Key Features

### ğŸ“Š **Smart Risk Assessment**
- Calculates overall risk level: ğŸŸ© Low / ğŸŸ§ Moderate / ğŸŸ¥ High
- Tracks unique credentials (not just total occurrences)
- Provides detailed breakdown by node type

### ğŸ”— **Direct Workflow Links**
- Clickable links to each workflow mentioned
- Shows last execution status (ğŸŸ¢ success / ğŸ”´ failed)
- Displays execution timestamps

### ğŸŒ **Bilingual Support**
- Full support for French and English
- Switch language with a single variable

### ğŸ“§ **Beautiful HTML Email**
- Clean, professional formatting
- Color-coded risk levels
- Emoji icons for easy scanning

---

## ğŸš€ Quick Setup (5 minutes)

### 1ï¸âƒ£ Configure Credentials
- **N8N API**: Generate an API key in your N8N settings
- **Gmail OAuth2**: Set up OAuth2 for Gmail sending

### 2ï¸âƒ£ Set Your Variables
Edit the "Set Config Variables" node:
```javascript
{
  "email_to": "your.email@domain.com",
  "project_name": "My-N8N-Project",
  "server_url": "https://n8n.yourdomain.com",  // NO trailing slash!
  "Language": "EN"  // or "FR"
}
```

### 3ï¸âƒ£ Test & Activate
- Click "Execute Workflow" to test
- Check your email inbox
- Activate for weekly automation

---

## ğŸ“§ Example Report Output

**Subject**: ğŸ”’ Audit Report My-Project â€“ Risk ğŸŸ§ Moderate

**Content**:
```
ğŸ“Š Summary
â€¢ Credentials involved: 8 (5 unique)
â€¢ Nodes involved: 12
  - ğŸ’» code: 4
  - ğŸŒ httpRequest: 3
  - ğŸ” ssh: 2
â€¢ Community nodes: 1
â€¢ Overall risk level: ğŸŸ§ Moderate

ğŸ” Credentials Risk Report
ğŸ”¹ Credentials with full access
- ğŸ”‘ My AWS Credentials
- ğŸ”‘ Database Admin

ğŸ“‹ Workflow: Data Processing Pipeline ğŸŸ¢ (25-10-2024 06:15 â†’ 06:16)
  - ğŸ’» Process Data
  - ğŸŒ API Call

ğŸ§© Nodes Risk Report
[...detailed node analysis...]
```

---

## ğŸ¨ Customization Options

### Change Schedule
Modify the "Schedule Trigger" node to run:
- Daily at 8 AM
- Monthly on the 1st
- Custom cron expression

### Add Recipients
Add multiple emails in the Gmail node's `toList` parameter

### Adjust Risk Thresholds
Edit the JavaScript in "Format Audit Report" nodes to customize when risk levels change

### Use Different Email Service
Replace Gmail node with:
- SMTP
- Microsoft Outlook
- SendGrid
- Any email service N8N supports

---

## ğŸ’¡ Use Cases

âœ… **Compliance Monitoring**: Track security posture for audits  
âœ… **Team Awareness**: Keep your team informed of security status  
âœ… **Change Detection**: Notice when new risky nodes are added  
âœ… **Best Practices**: Get recommendations to improve security  
âœ… **Multi-Environment**: Run separate instances for dev/staging/prod

---

## ğŸ”§ Technical Details

**Nodes Used**: 8  
**Credentials Required**: 2 (N8N API + Gmail OAuth2)  
**External Dependencies**: None  
**N8N Version**: Compatible with latest N8N versions  
**Execution Time**: ~10-20 seconds

---

## ğŸ“‹ Requirements

- N8N instance with API access
- Gmail account (or other email service)
- N8N API key with audit permissions
- Valid SSL certificate for workflow links (recommended)

---

## ğŸ› Troubleshooting

**Empty report?**  
â†’ Check your N8N API key has audit permissions

**Workflow links don't work?**  
â†’ Verify `server_url` is correct and has no trailing slash

**No execution status shown?**  
â†’ Workflows must have been executed at least once

**Wrong language displayed?**  
â†’ Set `Language` to exactly "FR" or "EN" (uppercase)

---

## ğŸŒŸ Why This Template?

Unlike basic monitoring tools, this workflow:
- âœ… Provides **context-aware** security analysis
- âœ… Links directly to **affected workflows**
- âœ… Shows **real execution data** (not just theoretical risks)
- âœ… Calculates **unique credential exposure** (not just counts)
- âœ… Supports **bilingual** reports
- âœ… Delivers **actionable recommendations**

---

## ğŸ¤ Feedback & Support

Found this helpful? Please rate the template!  
Have suggestions? Drop a comment below.  

**Pro tip**: Combine this with N8N's native alerting for real-time incident response!

---

**Tags**: #security #audit #monitoring #compliance #automation #email #reporting #credentials #governance

---

## ğŸ“œ License

MIT - Feel free to modify and share!

assignments.name: server_url
assignments.value: YOUR N8N SERVER URL WITHOUT THE / AT THE END

parameters.content:
## 1ï¸âƒ£ Schedule Trigger (Weekly) 
**â° WEEKLY TRIGGER**
Automatically runs every Monday at 6 AM
â†’ Change schedule in node settings if needed
â†’ Can be set to daily, monthly, or custom cron

## 2ï¸âƒ£ Set Config Variables 
**âš™ï¸ CONFIGURATION - EDIT THIS FIRST!**
ğŸ“§ email_to: your.email@domain.com
ğŸ“ project_name: Your-Project-Name
ğŸŒ server_url: https://n8n.yourdomain.com
   âš ï¸ NO trailing slash (/)!
ğŸŒ Language: "EN" or "FR"

â†’ These variables control the entire workflow
â†’ Must be configured before first run

## 3ï¸âƒ£ Generate a security audit 
**ğŸ” SECURITY AUDIT GENERATOR**
Calls N8N API to generate security audit

ğŸ“Š Analyzes:
- Credentials risks
- Dangerous nodes (Code, SSH, HTTP, etc.)
- Instance security settings

ğŸ”‘ Required: N8N API credential
â†’ Create API key in N8N Settings â†’ API
â†’ Add credential in this node

## 4ï¸âƒ£ Filter duplicate WorkflowID 
**ğŸ”„ DEDUPLICATION**
Extracts unique workflows from audit results

â†’ Removes duplicate workflow entries
â†’ Prepares data for execution lookup
â†’ Automatic - no configuration needed

## 5ï¸âƒ£ Get last executions
**ğŸ“Š EXECUTION STATUS FETCHER**
Gets last execution for each workflow

â†’ Retrieves success/failure status
â†’ Shows execution start/stop times
â†’ Enriches report with real data

ğŸ”‘ Required: Same N8N API credential as node 3

## 6ï¸âƒ£ If Language

**ğŸŒ LANGUAGE ROUTER**
Routes to FR or EN formatter

If Language = "FR" â†’ French report
Otherwise â†’ English report

â†’ Based on variable set in node 2
â†’ Automatic routing - no config needed

## 7ï¸âƒ£ Format Audit Report

**FRENCH/ENGLISH FORMATTER**
ğŸ“ Creates:
- Markdown version
- HTML email version
- Email subject with risk level

ğŸ“Š Calculates:
- Unique credentials count
- Nodes breakdown by type
- Overall risk level: ğŸŸ© ğŸŸ§ ğŸŸ¥

â†’ Automatic - no configuration needed

## 8ï¸âƒ£ Send Gmail (HTML)


**ğŸ“§ EMAIL SENDER**
Sends formatted HTML report via Gmail

âœ‰ï¸ Sends to: Address from node 2 (email_to)
ğŸ“¨ Format: Rich HTML with links & colors
ğŸ”— Includes: Direct links to workflows

ğŸ”‘ Required: Gmail OAuth2 credential
â†’ Setup OAuth2 in Google Cloud Console
â†’ Add Gmail credential in this node

âš ï¸ Can be replaced with SMTP, Outlook, etc.

## ğŸ¯ Quick Setup Checklist
âœ… 1. Create N8N API key (Settings â†’ API)
âœ… 2. Setup Gmail OAuth2 credential
âœ… 3. Edit "Set Config Variables" node:
      - email_to
      - project_name
      - server_url (no trailing /)
      - Language (EN or FR)
âœ… 4. Test workflow manually
âœ… 5. Activate for weekly execution

## ğŸ’¡ Configuration Tips
**ğŸ”§ CUSTOMIZATION OPTIONS:**

Schedule:
â†’ Node 1: Change trigger frequency

Risk Thresholds:
â†’ Nodes 7: Edit JavaScript conditions
   if (totalCredentials > 5) { ... }

Email Recipients:
â†’ Node 8: Add multiple emails in toList

Email Service:
â†’ Node 8: Replace with SMTP/Outlook/etc.

## ğŸ“Š Report Contents
**ğŸ“§ YOU WILL RECEIVE:**

ğŸ“Š Summary Section:
- Total & unique credentials
- Nodes breakdown by type
- Community nodes count
- Overall risk: ğŸŸ© Low / ğŸŸ§ Moderate / ğŸŸ¥ High

ğŸ” Credentials Risk Report:
- Exposed credentials list
- Associated workflows

ğŸ§© Nodes Risk Report:
- Dangerous nodes detected
- ğŸ”— Clickable workflow links
- ğŸŸ¢/ğŸ”´ Last execution status
- â° Execution timestamps

ğŸ¢ Instance Risk Report:
- Security settings review
- Recommendations

## âš ï¸ Important Notes
**ğŸš¨ BEFORE FIRST RUN:**

1. Server URL Format:
   âœ… https://n8n.domain.com
   âŒ https://n8n.domain.com/

2. Language Parameter:
   âœ… "EN" or "FR" (uppercase)
   âŒ "en" or "English"

3. API Permissions:
   â†’ N8N API key must have audit access
   â†’ Check in Settings â†’ API â†’ Permissions

4. Gmail Setup:
   â†’ OAuth2 required (not just password)
   â†’ Enable Gmail API in Google Cloud

## ğŸ› Troubleshooting

âŒ Empty report?
â†’ Check N8N API key permissions

âŒ Workflow links broken?
â†’ Verify server_url format (no trailing /)

âŒ No execution status?
â†’ Workflows must be executed at least once

âŒ Wrong language?
â†’ Language must be exactly "EN" or "FR"

âŒ Email not sent?
â†’ Check Gmail OAuth2 credential
â†’ Verify email_to address is valid

## ğŸ“ˆ Expected Results
**âœ… WEEKLY EMAIL WITH:**

Subject: 
"ğŸ”’ Audit Report [Project] â€“ Risk ğŸŸ§ Moderate"

Content:
- Executive summary with metrics
- Color-coded risk levels
- Direct links to affected workflows
- Real-time execution statuses
- Actionable security recommendations

ğŸ“Š Typical execution: 10-20 seconds
ğŸ“§ Email arrives within 1 minute

user.name: Matthieu
user.bio:
8 years exp in IT over different kind of task, from support to sysadmin.
Automation learner and builder.
I will share simple workflow that can be used in various situation.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
